etymologies: mid 19th century: modern Latin, from Niobe, by association with her father Tantalus (so named because the element was first found in tantalite)

definitions: the chemical element of atomic number 41, a silver-gray metal of the transition series, used in superconducting alloys.
shortDefinitions: chemical element of atomic number 41, silver-grey metal of transition series, used in superconducting alloys
